revised_title: The Recoil from Light: Experimental Investigation of Light Pressure on a Source
tldr: This article describes an experiment conducted by J.H. Poynting and Guy Barlow to measure the pressure of light against its source, known as the recoil from light. They used a series of discs with different configurations to study the pressure exerted by light on the source. The results showed that light pressure is a real phenomenon and has implications for understanding the interaction between light and matter.
